title: Is Jayson Tatum practicing with Celtics teammates? Latest social media post seems to indicate as much
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a Celtics workout in San Francisco, sparking speculation of his imminent return.
Tatum has been sidelined the entire season due to an Achilles tear, participating in scrimmages earlier in February.
The Celtics' upcoming schedule includes several home games, increasing speculation Tatum might return soon.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko praised for their call during Team USA's women's hockey gold win over Canada in overtime.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir applauded for letting Alysa Liu's figure skating gold routine play out with minimal commentary.
NBC Sports broadcasters displayed notable restraint, enhancing key Olympic moments by allowing performances to resonate with audiences.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends free rides for MBTA bus routes 23, 28, and 29 through June 2026.
Federal pandemic relief funds are covering $340,000 monthly to support the extension.
The future of the fare-free bus program beyond June remains uncertain, city officials are in discussions with the MBTA.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County and Essex County reported the highest snow totals, with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches.
A high-impact nor'easter is expected Sunday night into Monday, potentially causing blizzard conditions and power outages.
Worcester County received varied snow amounts, with Princeton reporting 4.8 inches and Worcester Airport 2.9 inches.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa from Canton is participating in the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the 2013 bombing victims.
LaRosa, aged 30, drew inspiration from her coworker who has completed the marathon 24 times.
The marathon on April 20, 2026, is significant to LaRosa, marking a personal and emotional journey.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac sentenced to 15 months for fraudulently using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy a golf course.
Kirouac secured EIDLs through the CARES Act, misusing $600,000 for the Angus Lea Golf Course purchase.
He received loans under false pretenses for multiple companies and failed to disclose a company sale to the SBA.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, was charged with multiple counts of larceny and drug possession after shoplifting from high-end Boston stores.
Cutelis, with a 25-year criminal record, allegedly stole items from Lululemon and Ralph Lauren worth thousands in November.
A judge set a $2,500 bail and ordered Cutelis to stay away from involved stores; he's held on a New Hampshire fugitive charge.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will remain the leadoff hitter for the Red Sox in the 2026 season, manager Alex Cora announced.
Anthony hit .336 with six home runs as a leadoff hitter last season, finishing third in AL Rookie of the Year voting.
Willson Contreras will bat cleanup, with Trevor Story, Jarren Duran, or Wilyer Abreu likely filling the two and three spots.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses influence from Joan Baez and her rebellious approach to country music, addressing societal issues.
Price's husband, Jeremy Ivey, has Massachusetts ties, having lived in Athol and been homeless briefly in Boston.
Price's new album, 'Hard Headed Woman,' was nominated for two Grammys; she performed at Newport Folk Fest frequently.

title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Mass. Eye and Ear from Deering, New Hampshire.
Whitaker's daughter, treated at Mass. Eye and Ear, had severe sinus cysts affecting her facial nerve and ear canal.
The treatment included an MRI, sleep study, and surgery to remove the cysts without affecting nerve function.
